The light source is moving to either the back left or the back right, and the task is to determine how the positions and sizes of these shadows will change.
The direction and length of a shadow depend on the position of the light source relative to the object.

If the light source moves closer to the object, the shadow gets longer. If the light source moves away from the object, the shadow gets shorter. If the light source moves sideways, the shadow shifts in the opposite direction.
